body: Expectation: when a pull request modifies the `**/*.md` files, the GitHub Action will apply the `document` label to it. We can see the status of the GitHub Action in the `check` tab: This patch is quite simple to just set up the GitHub Action and test it, we can apply more labels automatically in the future, e.g. apply `agent`, `plugin` when a pull request add a agent plugin, by detecting the modified file paths
Isn't it a callback implementor? I am little confused. How could you enhance all callback implementors? It is possible, but not recommended.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/kafka-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/plugin/kafka/define/KafkaProducerInstrumentation.java 

I intercept the doSend method, There is no problem with native kafka-clients
I haven't changed this piece of code at all. If I need to raise the parameters of the interface, is there a better way?
I mean, you need to intercept buildCallback method, and create a manual class implementing Callable and EnhancedClass. Make sense?
Thank you, I got it.

Have you enhanced `InterceptorCallback`? I think the snapshot could propagate through the constructor.
Yes, I enhanced it, but it wrapped my class, so I didn't get the snapshot, I'm going to see now how do I pass it through the constructor，thanks.
You should intercept the constructor. Then you could get it at the initialization stage.

As we know, we should keep utc8 in china's app server, otherwise it will cause lots of problems of the business.
It should be OK. But I am working for US company, so the system is running on UTC 0.

Hi, I just came across this interesting issue, because we are hitting this problem when we are evaluating Skywalking for our production environment for the zipkin client.  

I think the core problem is that, in the distributed OLA envirnoment, one single OLA needs to collect all the span information in order to calculate the segment informatoin. I have a draft work-around idea, and would like to discuss here. 

Lets say, we put a Kafka broker in the middle of zipkin and skywalking OLA, and all span informaiton with the same traceid is routed to the same partitoin of the Kafka topic, and all the messages of one particular partition will be delivered to the same OLA node. Will this solution solve the problem in certain degree?  Dear @wu-sheng, looking forward for your response. Thanks.

> Will this solution solve the problem in certain degree?

I wouldn't recommend to do that. Because, if you dig a little deeper, you will find there is another issue, which is the Zipkin span could include optional tags. Meaning, you can't guarantee the segment built successfully.

I think I have proposed the design, you could build OAL Source(s) from Zipkin spans directly, about how to built that, I recommend Redis or Kafka(MQ) to find the client/server span match. You don't need the whole segment and trace.

Then for trace details, using current SkyWalking ElasticSearch Zipkin storage.

Look forward we could do this in this repo.

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/9/stalary/testReport-master-2019-09-24-10-15.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/309/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-09-24-10-15.log)
I am going to merge this

> > Will this solution solve the problem in certain degree?
> 
> I wouldn't recommend to do that. Because, if you dig a little deeper, you will find there is another issue, which is the Zipkin span could include optional tags. Meaning, you can't guarantee the segment built successfully.
> 
> I think I have proposed the design, you could build OAL Source(s) from Zipkin spans directly, about how to built that, I recommend Redis or Kafka(MQ) to find the client/server span match. You don't need the whole segment and trace.
> 
> Then for trace details, using current SkyWalking ElasticSearch Zipkin storage.
> 
> Look forward we could do this in this repo.

Thanks for the reply. I am a little confused . From what you described earlier: "I think mostly is in OAP cluster mode. Zipkin spans of a trace could be sent to the different instances in an uncertain time, so, we need to make client/server match perfectly. Such as using Redis Cluster to be central cache?(Maybe only)", I think you have implemented most of the feature. The only thing left behind is how to gurantee that all the span information are sent to the same OAP node? If so, then yes we can focus on thinking about how to implement this one.
@wu-sheng I have paste the local integration test result to the description of this PR. Please help review the pulsar scenario integration.
@ascrutae Please run tests on our INFRA

> Such as using Redis Cluster to be central cache?(Maybe only)"

Maybe, but I think only RPC related span should be cached. The most important thing is, how do you prepare to make match happen. The match rule should be `parent-span` and `current-span` matched, and those two spans belonging to different services(instances).

> I think you have implemented most of the feature. 

I think the status is
1. Trace persistent and query based on Zipkin native format, rather than using SkyWalking's. This is good.
1. Old analysis, `zipkin span -> skywalking segment` should be removed, not stable and much useful.
1. OAL analysis engineer and source definitions are there and making analysis much easier. You just need to assemble the source(s) and send it to the dispatcher.

> The only thing left behind is how to guarantee that all the span information are sent to the same OAP node? If so, then yes we can focus on thinking about how to implement this one.

That is one important part, and yes, we need to focus on this solution.

@codelipenghui Tests are 1 passed, 5 failure. Please check the log, we are running the cases parallel, is that some static port in your case?
@wu-sheng Currently, pulsar broker using static port, is that the error cause?

> Currently, pulsar broker using static port, is that the error cause?

You should bind port by using docker compose. This is the cause.

Sorry, i'm lost here. I have bind port by using:
```
expose:
      - "8082"
ports:
      - "{SERVER_OUTPUT_PORT}:8082"
```
Pulsar broker and pulsar scenario is in one container, why pulsar broker also need to bind a port?
What is the difference? Could you post the document of Elasticsearch?
The `totalHits` means the number of hit documents. The `getHits().length` means the numbe of recalled documents.
Thanks for explanation. I would say both ways should be same in the theory. Because ID should be unique in the global always.

Based on the design, the id is unique, then if hint more than one is being sure a bug. And this change could cover it up. I would recommend don't change in this way. But try to find out there are duplicated IDs.

So, I tagged this as won't fix and is closing this.

I have sovled this problem, we must keep jvm the same timezone between agent jvm and oap-server/ui jvm.

We need config TZ in the env of container like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917749/65565966-10ad9800-df84-11e9-8977-be46223d2673.png)

One major question
How to resolve the extension capability issue based on the container image? You could notice there are plenty of integration solutions are using network protocol to replace SPI, because in Cloud Native, container is not very friendly to SPI mode

And, do you read the latest English blog in our website? There is a DingTalk webhook forwarder open source project.

Actually, this bottleneck is just in  agent side.
You can config like this:
```
buffer.channel_size=10
buffer.buffer_size=10000
```
Notify that it will cost more resources.
